page.title: 14General Background
page.content: houses have been built. Most of the residents are young married couples, people tending, when they get older, to move out of Elsenham to larger surrounding villages and towns. Few of the residents work in Elsenham itself, most of them commuting to Bishops Stortford, some to Harlow and many to London. Elsenham Jam Factory and Greenham Quarry are two of the largest local employers and many more work at Stansted Airport. The village at one time had its own blacksmiths and bootmakers but their shops are now gone. It now only has a couple of general stores. During the Second World War Elsenham was bombed and a plane with its full load of bombs crashed in the village; fortunately the bombs did not explode.
